name: Triple Goddess Moon Sterling Silver Pendants: Hemitate Moonstone Lapis Perido Amber Amethyst
description:
Amethyst Triple Goddess Moon Sterling Silver Pendant 

Hematite - Moonstone - Lapis - Perido-  Amber - Amethyst

These small but powerful Triple Goddess Pendans are made of beautiful sterling silver. Carefully placed in the center of the Pendants full moon is an intriguingly lovely Stone. Perfectly sized to be worn on a delicate chain around your neck, or added to a charm bracelet allowing you draw the energy of the Goddess within each day. These beautiful Triple Goddess Pendans are each Â½ inch in size. Small, powerful and inspiring. 

* Moonstone; (Rainbow) helps to soothe and balance the emotions. Moonstone represents the great Mother Goddess. Her strength lies in her gentleness, and her ability to experience, process, and give passion unto feelings. Moonstone is used in magick of the Goddess, the moon, wishes, intuition, and balance.

* Amethyst; (Purple) is associated element of Water. Used in magick to understand Dreams and to make Dreams come true, Peace, Love, Happiness. Protection and Courage. Worn by healers and Psychics for directing power. Amethyst is a reducer of stress, so it can be used to great effect in today's pressured lifestyle. Use amethyst to calm fears, raise hopes, and enhance spirituality. Amethyst can also be used to enhance psychic abilities, and aid meditation.

*  Lapis Lazuli; (Blue) is associated elements of Water. Lapis Lazuli is a rare and expensive blue stone, sometimes with flecks of gold coloring. Believed to be a Goddess Stone seen as Her eyes in the blue sky. Lapis is used for Magick and Healing, as well as to bring Joy, Love, Fidelity, Psychic, Protection as will as to bring Courage.

* Perido; (Green) Guards against illusions, enchantments, and nightmares. If anger is a problem for you, try using this gemstone as it is known to calm even the most raging anger. Peridot also calms nervousness and banishes negative emotions. Good for general healing, promoting sleep, and attracting money.

* Hematite; (Black) associated with the element of Fire. Hematite is a grounding and balancing stone believe to draw and remove negative energies from both around and within a person. Used in magick for Healing, Grounding and Divination.
Native American folklore states that war paint made from hematite will make one invincible in battle. People in the eighteenth and nineteenth centuries wore hematite jewelry during mourning to remove sadness.

* Amber; (Gold) is neither a gemstone nor a crystal, but is fossilized resin of pine trees, as such it frequently contains insects, and is therefore seen as a giver of life energy. Amber is associated with the elements of Fire and used in magick for Spirit work, .Luck, Healing, Strength, Protection, Beauty, Love. Amber also represents the Goddess or Great Mother, and is sometimes worn by Witches in a necklace of alternating amber and jet (representing the God) beads. It is used to enhance magickal ability and to ward off negativity, whether it is within your own spells or of those directed against you.

1.) Raven Wand: Approximately 8 inches long. {Black}
Long has the raven been associated with keeping secrets, and as such is often regarded as a totem animal that is great when one is seeking wellness, wisdom and intelligence. Ravens hold the secrets of both life and death and can travel between the worlds to carry messages to those within the veils. To have a Raven totem brings focus to aid you in your everyday trials, to overcome obstacles before you, and help guard your secrets.

2.) Fairy/Faery Wand: Approximately 8 inches long. {Gold}
A fairy or faery, faerie, or even fae; is a spirit or supernatural creature that is found in the legends, folklore, and mythology of many different cultures. Other ways to reference the faerie include the Little People, the Green Men, the Good Folk and the Lordly Ones. They are generally seen as humanoid in their appearance and have supernatural abilities such as the ability to fly, cast spells and to influence or foresee the future. Although in modern culture they are often depicted as young, sometimes winged females of small stature. They originally were of a much different image. Seen as tall, angelic beings or short wizened trolls being some of the commonly mentioned fay.

3.) Dragon: Approximately 9 Â½ inches long. {Red}
In Dragon Magick, specific dragons rule the elements and help through their powers when called. Each Dragon rules over their own Quarter and Element. Dragons are used in magick for enthusiasm, passion, courage, leadership, hate, jealousy, war, conflicts and are both harmful and helpful.

4.) Wizard: Approximately 9 inches long. {Clear}
The Wizard is looked at as being a Mystical Shaman. They are a male Witch, psychic healers and mediums within the veils of wisdom and knowledge. With the clairvoyant ability to see into the spirit of man, many fear them for they cannot hide the truth. 

5.) Double Pentagram: Approximately 8 inches long {Red}.
The Pentagram is a symbol of a star encased in a circle. Always with 5 points (one pointing upward), each has its own meaning. The upward point of the star is representative of the spirit. The other four points all represent an element; earth, air, fire, and water. All these things contributive to who we are in life and are a part of spirit of all things. The pentagram has long been believed to be a potent protection against evil, a symbol of conflict that shields the wearer and the home. The pentagram five points outwards is believe to be a sign of personal defensive, along with protective pentagon within the stars center.

Keys are a symbol of Hekate/Hecate the Goddess of Witches and Witchcraft since she carried and held the Keys to Hades. name: Hand Crafted Witches Besom/Broom (CT)
description:
Hand Crafted Witches Besom/Broom

This is a wonderful hand crafted besom broom lovingly made with materials from nature. Use this broom to sweep away negativity or hang it up for protection in your home or sacred space. Made from broom corn, grown specifically for constructing besoms, the handles are made from Yucca Cactus (a much more renewable and eco-friendly option than most hardwoods that is both light weight and strong), with a cord threaded through the end for hanging. Please allow for variations, as each one of these brooms is hand made and unique.  The Hand Crafted Witches Besom / Brooms will measure between approximately 43" - 53" long. 

Besom / Broom
Besom brooms are traditionally constructed traditionally associated with Witches, Wicca and Witchcraft. Besoms and brooms, are often used in Witchcraft and Paganism for 'sweeping the negativity away'. Besoms are also used as a protective device and often as the role of an 'inanimate familiar'. Traditionally an element symbolizing the union of the masculine and feminine principles, was used not for flying, but for the ritual cleaning of the working space, and protection and fertility rites. 

Besom or Witches Broom

Besom As A Fertility Symbol 
The old picture of the witch riding around on the broom's stick casting magic spells is believed to have come from a agricultural fertility rite, where the women rode around the fields(like on a hobby horse), with the broom between their legs, hoping to bring the farmers a good harvest. 

Jumping The Broom 
Many pagan traditions have the bridal couple, jump across the broom, a symbol of fertility (old bit of agricultural fertility magic), to signify the establishment of their new household. The brooms are usually decorated for the occasion and then kept in a place of honor in the home.
In many Wicca handfasting(marriage) rituals, couples often jump over the broom if they want children. 
Historically, brooms made great gifts for weddings or handfastings. Just add a little ribbon, some flowers, and your are good to go. No wrapping needed. Every new home needs a new broom! 

The Ritual Broom 
Witches use brooms in magick and ritual. The pagan broom or "besom" is used in ritual for cleansing the general circle or ritual area. The besom is sweeping away the psychic dirt, getting the area purified for the ritual at hand. 
A Witch may begin a ritual by sweeping the area with the magick broom, visualizing the psychic dirt being swept out of the ritual area. The sweeping also helps to get the mind ready for the ritual, quieting the mind and narrowing the focus for the witch. The besom is a purifier and is related to the element of Water.

Finding Other Witches 
Besoms have been used by Witches to indicate to other occultists that they were resident, or at work, by placing a besom (broom) outside the door. This is NOT to say that anyone who has a kitchen broom sitting outside their door is a witch.

Besoms, As A Symbol Of Protection 
Many Witches keep a besom by their door, or hanging from their door to protect the home from unwanted outside energies.

*MDF Board is a Medium Density Fiberboard. Fiberboard is a engineered wood product that is made out of real wood fibers. (Holding the same energies as wood.) Fiberboard is sometimes used as a synonym for wood because it holds a flat surface for carving, design and furniture. Fiberboard, particularly medium-density fiberboard (MDF), is heavily used in the furniture industry for pieces that will be visible, durable and give it the appearance of conventional wood but stronger. name: Ceramic Old World Spell Bottle Jar's: Wolfs Paw, Bear, Wolf, Sun
description:
Venus of Willendorf Old World Spell Bottle Jar

This wonderful Old World Spell Bottle Jar has been sculpted in the ancient ways of high fire ash kiln pottery. Glazed in natural clays and overlay with brown iridescent patina to highlight the full body on both front and back. Her arms are the handles at each side which make it ideal for adding a cord, leather or chain that will allow you to wear or hang this beautiful Venus of Willendorf Spell Bottle Jar as desired. 

With old world energy this container is perfect for mystical oils, sacred potions, resins or herbal spell mixes. Hang in your car for protection, at your office or computer for money, in your home for peace or wear this magickal Venus of Willendorf  Spell Bottle Jar with that personally blended spell for love or to keep away harm. It will be a wonderful and attractive vessel for your any magickal needs. 

The Venus of Willendorf, also known as the Woman of Willendorf, is an 11 cm (4.3 in) high statuette of a female figure estimated to have been made between 24,000 and 22,000 BCE. It was discovered in 1908 by archaeologist Josef Szombathy at a paleolithic site near Willendorf, a village in Lower Austria near the city of Krems. It is carved from an oolitic limestone that is not local to the area, and tinted with red ochre.
Since this figure's discovery and naming, several similar statuettes and other forms of art have been discovered. They are collectively referred to as Venus figurines, although they pre-date the mythological figure of Venus by millennia.

Each mystical Venus of Willendorf Spell Bottle Jar measures approximately 2" tall and 1" wide easily accommodating many spell ingredients, amulets, and other such magical articles.

name: Late 1800âs Antique Cast Iron Cauldron (HH)
description:
Late 1800âs Antique Cast Iron Cauldron

I love Cauldrons, they have a blessed and magickal energy especially those aged and blessed by time and use. I have been collection Cauldrons for years and helping others along the magickal path find truly old, antique and vintage cauldrons. I think perhaps the Goddess wants to make sure that this old and powerful Cauldrons find a good homes and are no longer discarded in barns and junked away like nothing. So I proudly search and look to find them wherever I go. 

This is a wonderful large sized highly desirable 3 legged Cast Iron Cauldron from the late 1800âs. We found this cauldron in the area and it is in wonderful shape but has been painted, this can be easily removed in a full heat seasoning of the cauldron. The Cauldron has no markings on the bottom. Make of all cast iron it will be perfect and useable for potions and food. A Witches Cauldron; is not only for magick, spells and rituals it is also a link to our past and to the old traditions where the cauldron was at the heart of the household. Used for cooking, for preparing herbal preparations as well as for scrying or divining by wise women and men. Many Witches work with and honor the Goddess Hekate. One of her most powerful symbols are the Keys of Hades. This magickal set of black cast iron Hekate Keys, The Keys of Hades are striking. Key of Hades; symbolize that the owner of the key is ruler of underworld. It is believed that Hecateâs primitive role as guardian of the cross-roads (typically the meeting place of three roads in the ancient world). Hekate as guardian meeting of roads, was facilitator of movement between worlds, particularly between earth and the underworld. Like Hades, Hecate's is often depicted her with a key or keys; but whereas the key of Hades could only lock, Hecate's key could also unlock. And this was to be the unique attribute that would firmly establish her position among the Gods. 

HEKATE (or Hecate) is the Goddess of Magick, Witchcraft, the night, moon, ghosts and necromancy. Hecate is the Goddess of the crossroads. She is most often depicted as having three heads. She is usually seen with two black hounds that were said to serve her.

This beautiful box is made of a clean cut teak wood. The Pentagram Tarot Box is 6 inches by 4 inches and just over 2 inches deep with lid closed. Featuring a large 2 inch pewter pentagram, used as a symbol of faith and protection within devotion and magickal rites on

Inside the Pentagram Tarot Box you will find a brand new unopened set of Rider Waite Tarot Deck. This is an amazing set. Check your prices and you will see that this set together is a better price than you can get anywhere else â¦ because it is Witch made and designed by The Glass Witch Magick Shoppe, and we know what you are looking for.

The Rider-Waite Tarot deck is probably the most popular tarot deck in use today in the United States. It was first published in 1910 by Rider & Company, a London publisher. Arthur Edward Waite designed the deck in collaboration with Pamela Colman Smith, an American artist. Waite was a member of the Order of the Golden Dawn, an occult society of the time. Waite considered symbolism of prime importance, so the cards of the Rider-Waite deck were created to communicate esoteric principles through symbols. 

Included With Deck: instruction booklet, blank card and promotion card 
Major Arcana:
Fool, Magician, High Priestess, Empress, Emperor, Hierophant, Lovers,
Chariot, Strength, Hermit, Wheel of Fortune, Justice, Hanged Man,

Frankincense: Removes negative energy when burned. It is used in exorcisms and is carried to promote luck and protection.

name: Rider-WaiteÂ® Tarot Deck (DB)
description:
Rider-WaiteÂ® Tarot Deck

The cards were drawn in 1909 by Pamela Colman Smith under the direction of Arthur Edward Waite. Smith's vibrant drawings transformed the standard tarot deck.

"A unique feature of the Rider-Waite deck, and one of the of the principal reasons for its enduring popularity, is that all of the cards, including the Minor Arcana, depict full scenes with figures and symbols. Prior to the Rider-Waite Tarot, the pip cards of almost all tarot decks were marked only with the arrangement of the suit signs -- swords, wands, cups, and coins, or pentacles. The pictorial images on all the cards allow interpretations without the need to repeatedly consult explanatory text. The innovative Minor Arcana, and Pamela Colman Smith's ability to capture the subtleties of emotion and experience have made the Rider-Waite Tarot a model for the designs of many tarot packs." Rider-Waite Tarot was named one of the Top Ten Tarot Decks of All Time by Aeclectic Tarot.

Pamela Colman Smith
Born February 16, 1878, in Middlesex, England to American parents, Smith's childhood years were spent between London, New York, and Kingston, Jamaica. During her teens, she traveled throughout England with the theatre company of Ellen Terry and Henry Irving. Thereafter, she began formal art training at Pratt Institute of Brooklyn, graduating in 1897.

Smith returned to England, where she became a theatrical designer for miniature theatre, and an illustrator -- mainly of books, pamphlets and posters. Around 1903, she joined the Order of the Golden Dawn. In 1909, under the guidance of Arthur Edward Waite, she undertook a series of seventy-eight allegorical paintings described by Waite as a rectified tarot pack. The designs, published in the same year by William Rider and Son, exemplify the mysticism, ritual, imagination, fantasy, and deep emotions of the artist.

Arthur Edward Waite
Born in America in 1857, Waite was raised and educated as a Catholic in England. Beginning at the age of 21, Waite pursued research and writing on psychical and esoteric matters. Soon after joining the Hermetic Order of the Golden Dawn, he became the Grand Master, and redirected the focus of the order from magic to mysticism. The Golden Order, whose structural hierarchy was based on the Kabbalah, is considered the single greatest 20th century influence on the occult. Waite was a prolific author of occult texts, works on the Holy Grail, and the body of mystical knowledge, which comprises the basis of modern Tarot. He is best known as the co-creator of the Rider-Waite Tarot deck and author of its companion volume The Pictorial Key to the Tarot, first published in 1910.

*)O(*  While the images are deceptively simple, almost childlike, the details and backgrounds hold a wealth of symbolism. Some imagery remains close to that found in earlier decks, but overall the Waite-Smith card designs represent a substantial departure from their predecessors. Among other changes, Waite had the Christian imagery of most older tarot decks' cards toned downâthe 'Pope' card became the 'Hierophant', the 'Papess' became the 'High Priestess'. The Minor Arcana are illustrated with detailed scenes and images by Smith, again a departure from many earlier decks with much simpler designs for the Minor Arcana but aligning this deck with, for example, the Sola Busca Tarot. The symbols used were influenced by the 19th century magician and occultist Eliphas Levi.

The Watching Raven - 03
 
Appearing throughout the myths and legends of many cultures throughout history as well as many more modern stories, the Raven is often held to be sacred. Within Native American lore, the Raven is considered to be a great mystery, a source and guardian of ceremonial magic and healing circles. The Raven is recognized as symbols of wisdom and prophecy scared to Morgaine, Hekate and other powerful Gods and Goddesses. 

Each statue perfectly depicts this sacred bird. Sculpted of cold cast resin, it vividly details every feature of the Raven. Sitting perched upon a stone overlooking her domain. Raven, is sacred, in high magick for to honor the Raven will bring power within magick. Raven magick is a powerful and will give you courage to enter the darkness of the void, which is the home of all that is not yet in form. The Raven is of brought light out of darkness. name: Goddess Luna Moon Lotus Plaque (AT)
description:
Goddess Luna Moon Lotus Plaque

The mystical Goddess Moon Lotus Plaque is wonderful for those that work with the Goddess found within the soft glowing full moon. With a interwoven filigree design representing the Lotus flower and the Goddess of the Moon.

This beautiful Luna Moon Lotus Plaque is formed of recycled pressed fiber, wood and paper. Painted in a soft blue with undertones of moonlight white that has been hand stressed to give it the appearance of an vintage piece. Approximately 16 inches round and 1 inch thick this wonderful piece will make a mystical and impressing addition to any room or altar area.

The Goddess for many of us is seen within the symbolism of the moon. The Moon Goddesses are important in many cultures around the world where they form a central role in mythology. The moon is associated with the divine female as in many tribal societies the feminine cycles were linked to the phases of the moon. Many of the lunar Goddesses, like Hecate and Cerridwen are also associated with magick and the intuitive nature of women.

The lotus representing the Moon and seen as a Lunar plant, can also be found in Indian and Oriental mythologies. The Hindu creation myth says that the golden lotus was brought forth from the primordial waters and that the Hindu trinity of Brahma, Vishnu, and Shiva are each found seated on a golden lotus. Vishnu is said to have slept on a lotus and then had a lotus stem issue from his naval. Brahma, the creator God, is said to have sat on the lotus while he performed his creative work comprised of spirit and matter (or fire and water). The consort to Vishnu, Lakshmi, came forth from the ocean upon a white lotus. Lakshmi is the goddess of wisdom and compassion. Some believe and compare her to the Roman Goddess, Venus. In addition, the "lotus bearer" in Hindu mythology is Padmapani, who holds a lotus in each of his four hands

name: Book of Shadows Tarot: Barbara Moore (EB)
description:
Book of Shadows Tarot: Barbara Moore

* On a personal note, this is one of the most beautifully magickal Tarot sets I have enjoyed owning. Barbara out did herself with the understanding she added to this deck.
Lady Abigail

This powerful tarot is lovingly crafted upon Wiccan beliefs and practices. On this magical journey, youâll encounter beautiful gods and goddesses, joyous Sabbat celebrations, spell-weaving rites, and vivid scenes central to Pagan spirituality. From the suitsârepresented by air, fire, water, and earthâto the major arcana, the tarotâs overall structure is built upon Wiccan themes. Barbara Mooreâs book introduces Pagan/Wiccan concepts, offers practical guidance on using the deck, and provides spreads.

The Book of Shadows Tarot Kit features one deck, Volume 1: As Above, and is designed to hold a second deck, Volume 2: So Below, to be released in 2013.

Hardbox kit (5 1/4 x 8 1/4) includes Volume 1: As Above deck (78 full-color cards) and full-color, 160-pp book

By the Author: How the Deck Came to Be
 
In 2008 I spent some time in Italy with the good folks at Lo Scarabeo. They asked me to create a deck, or rather a pair of decks. The set was to be called The Book of Shadows Tarot and was to be comprised of two separate decks. Beyond that, they had no requirements. I was free to do whatever I wished within that framework.
 
One of the key tenets for me is: As Above, So Below, so I decided to use that as my organizing theme. The first deck, As Above, is a non-RWS deck that represents the theory and teachings of Wicca. The second deck, So Below, is a RWS-based deck that shows how the magic of Wicca (for I believe that all of Wicca is Magicâ¦although not necessarily the same as Witchcraft) is experienced by Wiccans in every day life.

* Legend of the Fleur-De-Lis 
The English translation of "fleur-de-lis" (sometimes spelled "fleur-de-lys") is "flower of the lily." This symbol, depicting a stylized lily or lotus flower, has many meanings. Traditionally, it has been used to represent French royalty, and in that sense it is said to signify perfection, light, and life. Older legends speak of the Fleur-de-lis three "petals," symbolizing the Goddess as Maiden, Mother and Crone seen in the female or Goddess Trinity. Later it was adopted by the christian church the fleur-de-lis was used to represent the Holy Trinity of man.

name: Pagan Visions for a Sustainable Future (GF)
description:
Pagan Visions for a Sustainable Future  
by: Ly de Angeles, Emma Restall Orr, Thom van Dooren

I have this book and enjoyed reading it. It is not a book that gives you all the answer to life, being Pagan or the future. But it does give a deep an understanding to the complex views, philosophy, psychology, within reality of the Pagan world. It does not tell you the answers but gives you the tools to find the truth within yourself.  

Book Information: 
Representing diverse arenas of Paganism, eleven established activists, authors and academics passionately debate the critical issues facing modern Pagans. These provocative discussions-exploring feminism, magickal ecology, ancient Egyptian ethics, political activism, globalization, the power of truth, sacred communities, and environmental spirituality -challenge readers to reconsider what it means to be Pagan in the twenty-first century.

name: Elemental Fairies: Fire Fairy, Water Fairy, Air Fairy or Earth Fairy
description:
Elemental Fairies: Fire Fairy, Water Fairy, Air Fairy or Earth Fairy

We have been looking for some time to find the perfect represented energy of the Elemental Fairies. These 4 Elemental Fairies are each a stunning fairy statues dedicated itâs on mystical elements. The statues are amazingly beautiful. Each has unbelievable detail and their beauty can be seen from any angle. Hand painted cold cast resin. Each Elemental Fairy Stands 12 inches by 4 inches by 4 inches. Let one or all four bless your home with their special gifts.

1. * Elemental Fire Fairy:  Fire fairies are known for their short temper. When this happens they burn things in their path. They are the ones that cause forest fires. They can be quite nice, though. The spirit of the hearth fire is often thought of as female, and was once widely worshipped as a Goddess, formless essence symbolized by the flame, which flows through everything that has life. As the domestic hearth is the sacred center of the home, the hearth of the Gods is the center of the cosmos. She presided over all hearth and altar fires. The hearth was in the care of the woman of the home and before each meal something was thrown on the fire as an offering.

2. * Elemental Water Fairy: The Water Fairies can breathe under water. They live, usually, on the bottom of some source of water. They usually donât like humans because they think they are too loud so they try to avoid them. They are very peaceful and are not know for violence. The term Water Fairy or Sprite is a broad term referring to a number of supernatural legendary creatures. The term is generally used in reference to elf-like creatures, including fairies, and similar beings (although not earth beings), but can also signify various spiritual beings, including ghosts. 

3. * Elemental Air Fairy: Air Fairies are very nice and love to watch over people and try to make sure they donât get hurt. They are known to cause storms when mad. They also do this when Earth Fairies ask them to because the ground is to dry. Some fairies seem to represent spirits of weather, particularly whirlwinds, wind, storm, rain, lightning, sunshine and so on. Air Fairies are believed an important air spirit, one of the three primary spirits along with the Moon and Sea. They live far above the earth and controlled the weather, but punishes human misdeeds with sickness and bad weather.

4. * Earth Fairies live in woods, gardens, and other places with many plants. They are known for helping travelers without them knowing it. They love animals, especially the squirrel. Working with must be treated with the utmost respect. Earth elementals are concerned with the physical world, with growth, formation, strength and health. Earth elemental magick might include working with plants, crystals, gardens, and the wildwood. 
The Glass Witch Magick Shoppe

name: Extremely Rare Antique Cast Iron Mortar & Pestle (HH)
description:
Extremely Rare Antique Cast Iron Mortar & Pestle

A Witchâs mortar and pestle is a tool used to crush, grind, and mix solid substances like herbs even crystals and stones to mix and blend into healing brews, cream as will as for use in spells and magick. The pestle is a heavy club-shaped object, the end of which is used for crushing and grinding. The mortar is a bowl once made of heavy cast iron is now more typically made of hard wood, ceramic or stone. 

The substance to be ground is placed in the mortar and ground, crushed or mixed with the pestle. Sometimes referred to as an "Apothecary Grinder".

This Extremely Rare Cast Iron Mortar & Pestle is made of heavy cast iron which as been pitted over many years of use and age. The Mortar stands just over 5 inches tall with a 6 inch wide bowl. The Wooden mallet Pestle is 11 inches long and appears to have been hand made for the Mortar. Both have a wonderful and vintage energy that can be felt when working with this magickal part. 

I have only slightly cleaned them since many of the spirit heart believe to clean them to much removes some of the energy held within them. There is some rusting on the Mortar but that is to be expected with something this old. We believe it dates back to the mid 1700âs to the late 1800âs. No apparent markings can be seen. The Mortar will need to be seasoned and cleaned but itâs owner.

* This is an genuine and authentic "antique " Cast Iron Mortar and Pestle. It is well over 100 years of age. From our research the mortar is approximately two hundred old, since the Pestle is wood and hand carved I can not be sure of the date but believe it to be around 100 years old. They are a set and are sold only as a set.

Condition: 
This measures in overall height, as measured from the bottom to the top, approximately 5 inches. The top interior diameter, as measured across the inside of the upper rim, measures approximately 6  inches.
The bottom diameter, as measured across the bottom, measures approximately 6 inches 
The inside of the mortar is approximately 4.5 inches deep.  
The total weight of both pieces, together, the mortar and the pestle, weighs approximately 7 pounds 10 ounces (Before shipping.)

By "ANTIQUE" we mean over 100 years of age.

Superficially the Green Man, which is believed to be Pagan, is perhaps a fertility figure or a nature spirit, similar to the woodwose (the wild man of the woods), and yet he frequently appears, carved in wood or stone, in churches, so that Pagans could have their on Gods within the walls.

name: Witch Made Samhaim Besom / Broom (CT)
description:
Witch Made Samhaim Besom / Broom

This magickal broom is made by Lady Abigail according to the histories and traditions of Samhain. The besom / broom is a Vintage childâs broom believed to be from around the 1960âs. The Broom is approximately 42 inches long with colorful Autumn flowering, orange, red and golden feathering and ribbons wrapped around the top of the bristles. 

Carefully added to the top is an amazing 1 inch pewter Flying Witch & 7/8 inch pewter Pentagram for protection and magickal strength. Also Lady Abigail has added a tiny green spell bottle with a removable cork top so you can add your on magickal blessings to the besom / broom as desired. 

This magickal Samhain Besom has been cleansed and is Ritual ready as well as perfect for a beautiful holiday decoration in your home, office or altar room area but can be used everyday for whatever magickal needs you have.
 
* Samhain
Samhain, All Hallows, All Hallow's Eve, Hallow E'en, Halloween, literally, the most magical night of the year. Exactly opposite Beltane on the wheel of the year, Halloween is Beltaneâs dark twin. 
Many have believe that Samhain is a Celtic holiday. In fact, it is startling how many ancient and unconnected cultures (the Egyptians and pre-Spanish Mexicans, for example) celebrated this as a festival of the dead. But the majority of our modern traditions can be traced to the British Isles and the Old World. 
Not only is Samhain the end of autumn, it is also, more importantly, the end of the old year and the beginning of the new. The Witchesâ New Year's Eve, when the New Year begins with the onset of the dark phase of the year, just as the new day begins at sundown.

name: Beautiful Hand Made Metal Dream Catcher (in Teal, Purple & Black)
description:
Beautiful Hand Made Metal Dream Catcher 

In some Native American cultures, a dreamcatcher (or dream catcher or "dream snare".) These magickal handmade Dream Catchers are made of an antiqued metal with feathers, stones.
Dream catchers are one of the most fascinating traditions of Native Americans. The traditional dream catcher was intended to protect the sleeping individual from negative dreams, while letting positive dreams through. The positive dreams would slip through the hole in the center of the dream catcher, and glide down the feathers to the sleeping person below. The negative dreams would get caught up in the web, and expire when the first rays of the sun struck them. 

 The dream catcher has been a part of Native American culture for generations. One element of Native American dream catcher relates to the tradition of the hoop. Some Native Americans of North America held the hoop in the highest esteem, because it symbolized strength and unity. Many symbols started around the hoop, and one of these symbols is the dream catcher. 

This Beautiful Hand Made Metal Dream Catcher has been adorned with stones, chips, feathers and will sparkle when the light hits them. With metal beads and chain these elegant dreamcatchers can be worn as Jewelry, hung in Windows for Protection, hung in a car or over a bed to enchant your space while helping to ensure a night full of good dreams.  

Each of our Beautiful Hand Made Metal Dream is 3 inches round. The beads, stones and feathers hang approximately 8 inches long making the entire piece 11 inches. Then we add a wonderful 29 inch chain allowing you to wear or hang this beautiful piece as your dreams desire.

Color Choices are Purple, Teal and Black.

name: Mystical Ravens Set (LB)
description:
Mystical Ravens Set 

The Raven is a spirited creature blessed by the Gods. Allowed to travel between the worlds of life and death as it carries messages into the veils.
Ravens are found all over the world in folklore, artwork and mythology. Whether the meaning of a Raven is good or bad depends on the people of that culture. Ravens have been regarded as omens of death, war, and bad luck to some, and creators of light, fire, magick, and change to others. Like any change within our lives, it depends on how you look at it. Change is the ending of one thing (death) and the beginning of something new (creation). Native American Indian mythology Raven is the bringer of light to the people. Just as Raven brought the stars, the moon, and the sun to us all; let Raven bring you to your own light and fly free into the magick of creation. 

This wonderful pair of Ravens are made from hard cast resin that has been painted and antiqued to have a mystical vintage appearance. One Raven stands guard upon his perch at 10 inches tall and 3 inches across. The second Raven looking forward possible unto the veils ever weary standing 7 inches high. This is a mystic set perfect for those whom call to the Raven in magick and spirit.

This pair of Beautiful Hand Painted Maracas are designed using natural coconut head with carved handles. Filled with seeds for a free-flowing sound. Handcrafted, the outer surface has been polished and hand painted with decorative colors. As a spirited creature of both earth and sea, a sea turtle as its crowning design. Perfect for Drumming Circles, Dance Circles, Rituals and Gatherings to raise the spirit within music and sound.

Maracas sometimes called rumba shakers are a native instrument of Latin America. They are a percussion instruments, usually played in pairs, consisting of a dried coconut shell filled with seeds or dried beans. Often one ball is pitched high and the other is pitched low. There is evidence of maracas were used by the natives of Colombia 1500 years ago. 

This set of maracas consist of one higher and one lower pitched maraca. Measures approximately 4 inches by 7 Â½ inches.

A Scrying mirror is used to develop your psychic abilities as you enter into another world hidden deep within the veils of life and death. Scrying is a method of divination that allows the practitioner to peek into the spirit realm. Scrying magick is a practice that involves obtaining spiritual visions by way of reflective, translucent, or luminescent items such as crystals, stones, glass, mirrors, water, fire, or smoke. Scrying has been used in many cultures as a means of divining for as long as time has been time. Using a Scrying Mirror is the preferred method for many within the metaphysical world. 

This beautiful Black Scroll Frame Scrying Mirror is designed using a hard cast resin frame and a wonderfully reflective iridescent black glass. Mystical and bold, sophisticated with a touch of the old world. This Black Scroll Frame Scrying Mirror has an energy and appearance of fairytales, dreams and light. This beautiful Black Scroll Frame Scrying Mirror measures approximately 9 Â½ inches wide and 14 Â½ inches tall. Sometimes called a Seer Glass this heavy Black Scroll Frame / and black iridescent mirror is designed to allow you clear visions as it draws your attention within the veils of the spirited depths. Many believe that using a black mirror assist in the ability to see and communicate with spirit energies. 

*  Mystical Cast Iron Scrying Mirror is Witch Made by Lady Abigail. It has been cleansed and blessed so that when you receive it, it is ready for you to charge with your personal energy. Blessing be.

Golden Leaf Agate: (also called "Golden Leaf Jasper") is a deep brown microcrystalline stone with mid to dark tan or gold patterns pressed through it. Although the term "Agate" usually refers to a translucent, banded form of Chalcedony, this stone is primarily an opaque brown with a gold coloring surfacing from deep inside. Thus, the alternate reference to "Jasper". While all Agates are considered protection stones, Gold Leaf Agate in particular is said to help lift depression and increase friendliness and happiness

Lore & History: 
 They have been used as gemstones, talismans and amulets for thousands of years. In fact, some of the very first primitive tools were formed of agate. Such examples were found in Ethiopia that tested to being created over 2 1/2 million years ago!

 Astrological Correspondence:

Designed with a vintage look and energy this Beautiful Fleur-De-Lis Leather Box seem to transport you back to that mystical world when Lords and Ladies would hid away there most important items of ritual and magick.

* Legend of the Fleur-De-Lis 
The English translation of "fleur-de-lis" (sometimes spelled "fleur-de-lys") is "flower of the lily." This symbol, depicting a stylized lily or lotus flower, has many meanings. Traditionally, it has been used to represent French royalty, and in that sense it is said to signify perfection, light, and life. Older legends speak of the Fleur-de-lis three "petals," symbolizing the Goddess as Maiden, Mother and Crone seen in the female or Goddess Trinity. Later it was adopted by the christian church the fleur-de-lis was used to represent the Holy Trinity of man.

* When I was in my teens I came across a small wooden doll of my Great Grandmothers. She had it carefully placed in a small box in the herb closet. It was hand carved and held together with twine and screws so it moved like a person would move and could be posed accordingly. After asking my Grandmother about it she explained it was a Binding Doll. It could be used for all forms of Binding magick from binding someone from doing negative magick to binding yourself from over eating. Over the years I tried to made these Binding Dolls and found it was not my gift. Then I found these wonderful Wooden figures that are bother flexible and can be posed as needed.

Once the spell is worked and has come to pass, cleans the Doll and put the Binding Doll and Crystal together and safely away until needed again. 

Here are a few ways the Binding Doll can be used:

To Send Energy: To place energy in the Doll for self or others by focusing on the Doll according to the  direction they desire to go. Jobs, New Home, Meeting People and so on.

Healing: Used to focus energy on a certain areas of the body for healing as well as for pacific needs. Such as Heart, Head and Headaches, Body Pains, Bones, Internal Needs, Pregnancy, Sleep to name only a few. 
To use you simply apply the magick and energy as you would in healing. Some people add band aids, herbs and politics accordingly for the healing work. 

Binding: You can bind others so that they can not see you or what you are doing by blindfolding the Doll. Stop someone from causing harm to you or others by binding the hands of the Doll. Stop someone from doing something harmful or going somewhere dangerous by binding the feet of the Doll. 

For personal Bindings: You can aid yourself with personal Binding. To stop yourself from over eating or to lose a few lbs. Bind the doll in the middle. To stop gossiping or stop smoking, bind and cover the mouth of the Doll with the Dolls hands. 

Remember, Do all magick according to your own heart: 

Be it good or be it not, think before you bind or not,
For the Karma is yours alone, let only the light be shown. 

Lady Abigail
Copyright Â© 11052011

description:
The Three Fates ~ The Three Graces Bronzed Statue

This intricately sculpted statue of the Three Fates also seen as the Three and Greek Goddesses of Fertility have been cased in high quality cold cast resin and hand finished with a heavy antique bronze piÃ±ata. The sculpture is a perfectly beautiful replica of the Three Graces sculpture from the Borghese Collection in the Louvre Museum in Paris. 

A simply unparalleled nude of the Three Fates, is perfect for any home or altar table. Beautifully sculpted and detailed allowing the beauty of the Goddesses to show clearly from both sides of the statue. Fully detailed you may choose to have one or two of the Goddesses facing forward by turning the statue. This amazing stature is approximately 10 Â½ inches tall and 7inches across with a wide 2 Â½ inch base.

* In Greek Mythology, the Three Graces were the Chrarites named Aglae, Euphosyne, and Thalia, usually considered daughters of Zeus and Eurynome. Seen as the Three Fates, in classical mythology, manâs destiny is controlled by the Three Fates. When people are born the Fates determine how their lives will unfold, what will happen to them and when they will die. All human beings, and even the Gods, were subject to their whims, except perhaps for Jupiter, although opinion differed on this matter in antiquity. 
The Fates are depicted from beautiful Goddesses to ugly old women, depending on your choice of history. (I choose beauty.) Each one with her own task. Clotho (the spinner) spun the âthread of life.â Lachesis (the allotter) measured the thread with her measuring rod and thus ordained how long someone would live. Atropos (the unturnable) cut the thread of life when the time had come. In the visual arts the Fates also sometimes stand for death, or accompany Death on his rounds.

1- Pink Glass Jar 7 day Candle for Spell work.

To use with spell for 9 nights. Afterwards, burn when dealing with energy loss or sickness. 

1- Parchment Sheet Healing Light Spell by Lady Abigail.

2- Rose Quart Crystals, One to keep and one to give share. For some they like to bury one of the Crystals after the spell is spend in thanks. Or give until the Goddess accordingly. 

1- Healing Oil blend by Lady Abigail

For anointing person during spellwork, times of healing or need. (Use sparklingly, it is very strong.

1- Pink Silkâish bag to keep Crystals and Oils.

* Please Note:

I have made this Breast Cancer Healing Spell Set according to my on healing and heart after being repeatedly asked to put one together for others. I can not make any promises on anyoneâs personal healing. Everyone must heal from within their own spirit and body according to their time. Yet, I do believe that a positive attitude, fighting spirit and blessings found within the Goddess aids in our recovery beyond any spell. 

This is my personal story: 

Breast Cancer: A Witches Story

It had been a peculiar day and I was confused with all the unfamiliar sensations that keep coming into my spirit. I was setting on the back porch swing with my one leg hanging down so I could keep moving. I was starring into the nothingness of something I could not explain. Even the air moving across my skin seemed to be saturated with a confused energy going from warm to cool and back again. I must have been deep into the consideration of it all when my Great Grandmother walked out from the kitchen. âYou all right Little One, or did someone walk across your grave?â Just then I could hear thunder rolling up from the valley across the hilltops. First soft and gentle, then louder like it was gaining power as it moved along. 

My Great Grandmother sat down with me on the swing and smiled as if she knew every deep thought I was having. âDonât worry honey,â she said. âSometimes our spirits quicken like butterflies leaving a cocoon. We know there is more life for us to live but our spirits fear we want get to it all in time.â I guess as children we canât really understand that there may not be enough time, that something can change every single moment of our life. That we may have to fight to get out of that cocoon and set our spirits free to live.

I hate going to doctors and on this day as I hung up the phone I was thinking how I really didnât have the time to waste going to the doctor or sitting in an office to get a mammogram. I was pretty good about going; I have a family history of breast cancer, but you know how it is, it will never happen to you. I made the appointment anyway, begrudging the time I could be doing something else. In a few weeks I found myself sitting there in my little paper waist shirt waiting for someone to come into the room and tell me all the x-rays and ultrasounds were good. Then I had that feeling come over me again; that feeling I had in childhood when my Great Grandmother would ask me if someone was walking over my grave. You know you never expect anything to be wrong, or maybe we donât want to think it is possible but life can change in an instant. 

The doctor walked into the office and before she could say a word, I could feel the tears running down my cheeks. I shook my head as if I could make it all go away but I couldnât. It was real and I had breast cancer. It was only a few days until I was in the hospital undergoing a double mastectomy. 

At that time I believed that my world and my life was changing and I no longer had any control of anything. I cried, I grieved, I asked why me. Okay, why not me. As a child of the Goddess I believe that everything we are given in life it to teach us, but it is also given to us that we, perhaps in some small way might help others if and when they face the same kinds of struggles.

I have to tell you there is nothing that will slap you back into reality as fast as looking down to where you once had breasts and finding none. In this moment you can either give into grief or find the guiding power to heal and survive. 

I could hear my Great Grandmother speaking to me just like she did as a child on that old porch swing. I could feel that my spirit was worried I wouldnât have enough time to do all I wanted to do in my life. I was going to have to fight for and it and I did. 

No one wants to have this terrible disease. But I did, and as breast cancer survivors will tell you, I always will have it; like some monster hidden behind a tree that might jump out and scare the crap out of you anytime and at any moment. Itâs there and not only there for me, but my daughter and my granddaughter.

Every person in America knows or will know someone with breast cancer in their lifetime. Sadly it could also be you. My faith in the Goddess and Her ability to heal me from my fears and this disease, I believe, was one of the greatest gifts of recovery I had. 

My gift back, is to help others be aware. 

April is when we have the; Breast Cancer Walk for the Cure in many areas of the country. These walks is extremely important to me and the hundreds of thousands of us all over the world that are breast cancer survivors. For that reason I have shared here my story as a Witch with breast cancer. 

Breast cancer is a killer. It has no respect for human life, it doesnât care what your income might be and it could care less where you live. Breast cancer is disease that can strike anyone at anytime, men and women. It is my hope that in sharing these few words of my survival of breast cancer; it will somehow help others to be aware. 

Breast Cancer Facts: 

*Over 40,000 people will die of breast cancer this year in the united states.
*One out of every seven women will develop breast cancer 
*A woman's chances of developing breast cancer increases with age: (I was in my 40âs) 
*Approximately 200,000 cases of breast cancer will occur in the United States this year. 

Traits common to breast cancer survivors: 

*They are well-informed and take control of their treatment 
*They know cancer is just a symptom and make life-style changes
*And most importantly, they have a positive attitude.

I share my story and ask that everyone become a part of every womanâs, and yes manâs, survival by supporting and doing what you can do to fight this killer of life. Goddess willing, Let us be the cure. 

Blessings and have a magickal pink day.
Lady Abigail
Copyright Â© 03252010

A Book Of Shadows is a Witch's greatest tool and used to store information you'll need along your magickal path. Many Witches, Pagans and Wiccans feel a Book of Shadows should be handwritten, but some use a computer to store information as well. Bear in mind that a Book of Shadows is considered a sacred tool, which means it is an item of power that should be consecrated or blessed with all of your other magickal tools. Your Book of Shadows provides a place for Craft secrets, spells, rituals, family traditions, otherworldly info and almost anything else a Witch can think of. As you copy your spells and rituals into your Book of Shadows this will transfer your energy into the book, but it also helps you to memorize the contents. 

These beautiful Book of Shadows have been Witch-made and handcrafted by Lord Rick. Made of wood to last for generations! It is 10 inches by 12 inches and holds any standard size paper. It come with 2 binding pins of 1 inch depth which can be easily removed to add or replace pages as needed. We have also included 2 extension pins so you can add even more pages when needed. 

On the front of each Wood Book of Shadows we have engraved design of magick perfect for your personal desires. The words âBook of Shadowsâ have been engraved proudly on the front. The brass hinges give an elegant look to the oak stained wood for a truly aged and old world appearance. The book has been hand varnished to seal in its beauty and assure the everlasting magick of your Book of Shadow. 

The Book of Shadows is a scared, private place where spells, rituals, and often inspirations are written. A Book of Shadows has the energy of the person who creates it, the spells within it and the spirit in which you keep it. Many Books of Shadow are handed down from generation to generation as blessings of those who honored the magick in times pasted. Now the tradition is yours. 

* Pentacle / Pentagram; The Pentagram is a symbol of a star encased in a circle. Always with 5 points (one pointing upward), each has its own meaning. The upward point of the star is representative of the spirit. The other four points all represent an element; earth, air, fire, and water. All these things contributive to who we are in life and are a part of spirit of all things. The pentagram has long been believed to be a potent protection against evil, a symbol of conflict that shields the wearer and the home. The pentagram five points outwards is believe to be a sign of personal defensive, along with protective pentagon within the stars center.

* The Triple Moon Goddess is described as threefold, or as appearing in groups of three, seen with the three phases of the Moon. Waning, Full and Waxing. Triple Goddess: as Maiden, Mother and Crone; sometimes seen as the three sisters or the "Great Goddess" who is threefold.

* Triquetra; typically represents the three stages of the feminine life cycle, the maiden (the young virgin), the mother (pregnancy and motherhood), and the crone (old age and wisdom). It can also represent the threefold of nature, earth, water, and sky. It is also a symbol of the triple Goddesses. Also the interconnected parts of our existence (Mind, Body, and Soul), or other concepts that seem to fit the idea of unending unity.

name: 7 Different Tears of the Goddess or Goddess Tear
description:
Tears of the Goddess or Goddess Tear Wiccan Witch Spiritual

Goddess Tears are designed to hold the spirit of the one who wears them within the energy of the Goddess. Each one is made with by melting glass rods and allowing the colors to mix with clear glass until they form a tear and fall. The Goddess Tear represents the many aspects of our lives with the Goddess as we see Her. 

Anointed and blessed from the night of the full moon through the night of the dark moon, they hold a balance of the Goddesses and Her power within them. In times of personal struggles you simple hold it in your hands and allow the energy within to fill your heart and soul with the love and light of the Goddess. 

This Goddess Tear is approximately 1 inch long and made of mixed colors. Each one slightly different from the other like a natural tear and comes in a small bag for protection. A black cord has been added for you to use but you can easily add the Goddess Tear to any chain, cord or ribbon. 

* New Color Black & Purple: Iâm not exactly sure how I made these. 1st and maybe only time I will end up the colors somehow mixed. The ribbons are dark almost black until held up to the light where purple appears to glow through. I love them and I hope you do tooâ¦ Lady Abigail 

Goddess Tears were something I designed simply by accident. In a time when my energy had been waning and I felt lost I decided to work with my glass and make some beads for a necklace. Then they get rid of the remains (all part not nourishing to them) in one little ball call a Owl Pellet. This pellet is full of tiny bones. Teeth and so forth that are perfect for spell work and magick. They are also considered clean bones because the came by way of natures laws. Also the Pellets hold energy and power from the Owls much stronger than a feather especially for those whom honor the Owl as their personal Totem. 

All Barn Owl Pellets are Heat Sterilized, and individually wrapped in aluminum foil. Filled with skeletal remains for identification of prey taken by the Barn Owl. Can be used to teach children the nature of food chains and to demonstrate the role of avian predators in the ecosystem, and to provide information about the presence of animals in a particular area. Each Barn Owl Pellet is from the wild and unique in size, shape, and contents. Owl Pellets are a Natural Magickal and Educational Tool. 

* No Owls are harmed in the harvesting of the pellets.

EACH KIT INCLUDES: 

A Beautiful "Full Color" Box (9"x 6"x 2") containing a Photograph of an adult Barn Owl. 
A 9 page Study Guide containing information about the Barn Owl, owl pellets, how to dissect owl pellets and how to identify the animal skulls found in owl pellets. To enhance this study guide we have included 7 photos, 6 illustrations of the skulls of common prey found in owl pellets and corresponding illustrations of the 6 common prey, along with illus- trations of the prey animals and two different views of the vole skeleton identifying the individual bones of the mouse skeleton. 
Bone Id Sheet comparing bones from rodents, shrews, moles, and birds. 
Plastic Forceps 
One Magnifying lens 
3 Heat Sterilized Barn Owl Pellets wrapped in aluminum foil 

Owls: The owl is the symbol of the feminine, the moon and the night.
The owl is the bird of magick and darkness, of prophecy and wisdom and are associated with the Goddess Athena. 
Barn Owl: This totem reflects the ability to the heart and the mind. It can connect you to spirits and the houses that they haunt. Mediums and âghost huntersâ often have this totem for protection and for its strong clairvoyant abilities.

Bones in magick: Different bones are used in different magick. Clean Bones used from natural law or a nature kill (Like these) are called clean bones and can be used in magick, spells, healing, powerful protection. 
Unclean Bones (Any from being killed or painful death are called unclean.) Those are used for spell casting and hexing. 

* The general the way to know what magick each item is best used for is to use them according to the bone. For instance a jaw bone would be used to stop gossip or skull to heal a headache... 
Blessings.
Lady Abigail

name: The Essential Guide to Crystals and Crystal Set (FC)
description:
The Essential Guide to Crystals and Crystal Set

The Essential Guide to Crystals All the Crystals You Will Ever Need for Health, Healing, and Happiness by: Simon Lilly [NEW]

This new edition of the respected and illustrated guide to crystals reveals the full power and mystery of these gems, which can heal our spirits and enhance our lives. More than 100 crystals are grouped by color and then presented individually through color photography and in-depth discussions of appearance, followed by descriptions of individual magick, healing properties and other practical uses, and the myths and legends surrounding each. There's advice on building and maintaining a collection, as well as expert guidance on crystal healing and meditation, using amulets and birthstones, and working with crystals aligned to our auras, chakras or reflexology points. 

Crystal Set

Rose Quartz

Rose quartz is a soothing, calming stone. It is used for love, and to increase self love and feelings of self worth. It brings healing and clarity to the heart and allows the wearer to learn to trust again. Balancing the emotions and healing emotional wounds, it brings peace and calm.

Sodalite

Sodalite brings inner peace and can calm hot tempered folk. Keep sodalite in your pockets and in every room of your house, so its peaceful properties will flow all around you.

Green Quartz

This stone has the ability to be programmed with the powers of other stones, and then substituted for that stone in any ritual. Great for psychic and as a general magickal power amplifier. Great for use in building a magick circle for money work. Green Quarts is used for money attraction, luck, health, gardening, longevity of life. 

Orange Calcite

Calcite is useful in working gemstone magick, as it doubles the strength and power of your spell. It is also useful in cleansing the aura, clearing all attachments and entities. Allows you to see the spiritual more readily. Native Americans consider this stone to be a holy stone of the land of their fathers that was bestowed upon them by the Gods.

Black Tourmaline

Simply excellent at repelling negativity. Can protect a person from the negativity of others and helps you shield or block from others. Increases vitality, energy, emotional stability, and intellectual acuity. Protects against negative spells. Excellent for grounding. Black Tourmaline can point you in the direction of things that will bring positive energy and is considered a psychic stone helping you see who and what may be bring problems, danger or troubles toward you. 

Quartz Crystal; Quartz enhances energy by absorbing, storing, amplifying, balancing, focusing and transmitting. It channels universal energy. Quartz also enhances thoughts, as they are a form of energy. Because it directs and amplifies energy, it is extremely beneficial for manifesting, healing, meditation, protection, and channeling.

name: 3 Tarot Decks: Pagan Cats ~ Crow's Magick ~ Robin Wood Tarot
description:
* Pagan Cats Tarot Deck by Magdelina Messina/ Lola Airaghi
A well favored deck among Pagans and Witches this Cat deck is both beautiful and bewildering. 
Cats have always had a special place within the pagan world of magic and mysticism, and with their almost supernatural grace and aloof personalities itâs no wonder why. The Pagan Cats tarot embraces these qualities, portraying them walking silently between worlds, and playing with the mysteries of life in their mischievous ways. 
The deck offers 78 Arcana that provide glimpses of the world through the playful and wise eyes of cats, perhaps helping you understand the mysterious that surround us or grow closer to your companion and familiar. Also included is a small pamphlet with basic instructions as to how to use your Pagan Cat Tarot for your divination. 

* Crow's Magick Tarot By Londa Marks 
The Crow's Magick Tarot by Londa Marks is designed to capture "the place of dreaming and visions" which is the world of the crow. It is a world where "strange planets and empyrean worlds merge with wildlife, cyber and geometric spirits." Birds and other creatures are dominant in this deck of bright colors on a black background. Even the court cards are represented by animals, not humans. Each card gives two keyword definitions as well as some astrological correspondence signs (although these are not explained in the text). There is a separate companion book for this deck called Crow's Magick. Londa is also the creator of the Londa Tarot. 

* The Robin Wood Tarot By Robin Wood 
The Robin Wood Tarot has rapidly become one of the most popular Tarot decks in the world. Its beautiful art, vibrant imagery and luminous energies, enchants everyone.
The 22 Major Arcana cards are filled with life that was previously unseen in the Tarot. It is also filled with the energy of nature, taking the images outside of rooms and into the beautiful abodes of the gods. For example, The High Priestess is an ageless woman wearing a lunar headband. Behind her are trees and a darkened sky lit only by the moon.
The shining strength of this deck lies in the fifty-six cards of the Minor Arcana. The characters on the cards almost seem to breathe. Often, the cards seem so dimensional you get the feeling you could jump into them. Watch the boy carve pentagrams on wooden disks in the eight of Pentacles. Gleefully help steal blades in the five of Swords. Join in the merry dance on the four of Wands.
The 56-page booklet explains everything to give a Tarot reading, including the upright and reversed meaning for each card and 3 different layouts. Each of the pip cards is given a word or short phrase to help you identify the meaning of the card with virtually no effort.
Pagans will love the influence of nature on this deck. Beginners will find it makes learning the Tarot fun and easy. Experienced Tarot readers will love the radiantly colorful, symbolic, and infinitely captivating deck. Get your copy right away.

name: Extremely Rare LARGE Antique Cast Iron Mortar & Pestle (y)
description:
Extremely Rare LARGE Antique Cast Iron Mortar & Pestle

A Witchâs mortar and pestle is a tool used to crush, grind, and mix solid substances like herbs even crystals and stones to mix and blend into healing brews, cream as will as for use in spells and magick. The pestle is a heavy club-shaped object, the end of which is used for crushing and grinding. The mortar is a bowl once made of heavy cast iron is now more typically made of hard wood, ceramic or stone. 

The substance to be ground is placed in the mortar and ground, crushed or mixed with the pestle. Sometimes referred to as an "Apothecary Grinder".

This Large and Extremely Rare Cast Iron Mortar & Pestle made of heavy cast iron which as been pitted over many years of use and age. The Mortar stands just over 6.5 inches tall with a 8 inch wide bowl. The base is 7.5 inches across and the bowl is 7 inches deep.

The Heavy Cast Iron Pestle is 11 inches long and they are the original set. Both have a wonderful and vintage energy that can be felt when working with this magickal set.

I have only slightly cleaned them since many of the spirit heart believe to clean them to much removes some of the energy held within them. There is some pitting on each piece which is only to be expected with something this old and rare. We believe it dates back to the mid 1700âs. No apparent markings can be seen, but the only one I could fine similar to this set was in England and dated to the early 1700âs. 

* This is an genuine and authentic "Antique" Cast Iron Mortar and Pestle. It is well over 100 years of age. Yet according to our research the mortar and pestle are approximately two hundred years old. They are a set and are sold only as a set.

Condition: 
This measures in overall height, as measured from the bottom to the top, approximately 6.5 inches. The top interior diameter, as measured across the inside of the upper rim, measures approximately 8  inches.
The bottom diameter, as measured across the bottom, measures approximately 7.5 inches 
The inside of the mortar is approximately 7 inches deep.  
The total weight of both pieces, together, the mortar and the pestle, weighs approximately 20 lbs. (Before shipping.)

By "ANTIQUE" we mean over 100 years of age.

name: Leather Book of Shadows: Goddess, Fairy, Celtic, Tree of Life, Solstice
description:
Leather Book of Shadows: 
Goddess, Fairy, Celtic, Tree of Life, Solstice

This beautiful array of ancient imagery in each Book of Shadows shows beautiful and a mystical energy. Each page found within this book are made from cotton scraps found at the floor of garment factories and recycled natural items such as fruit and vegetable husks, further enhancing this wonderful magick of this Book of Shadows. This blank book is approximately 300 pages in length, with stitched binding. 

Solstice Leather Blank Book
Portraying both the sacred Solstices, this beautiful leather-bound 4 1/2" by 6 1/2" journal is a wonderful representative of time passing throughout the year. The leather surface has been hand embossed and printed to portray the sun for both the winter and summer solstice in a stylized fashion, two separate images divided by the binding, which has be styled as the sweeping trunk of a tree. 

Fairy Leather Blank Book
Beautifully bound within red, hand-stitched leather, this delightful journal has been carefully embossed and dyed to portray a scene out of Celtic legend. On the front face you will find the image of a beautiful fairy, lithe and robed in gossamer with the wings of a butterfly, all framed within an elaborate border of Celtic Knotwork. This Knotwork extends then down the binding, and expands to embrace the picture on the back which shows a dragonfly, hovering among flowers. This book is approximately 7" by 5 1/2" in size.

Goddess Leather Blank Book of Shadows
Hand crafted and stitched green-dyed leather this thick leather bound 4 1/2" by 6 1/2" journal displays on its covers two very distinct and different views of the Goddess. On the front she would seem a wholesome being, nurturing and gentle-featured as she sits in the lotus position. With her chest bared but for her concealing hair, she sits before a backdrop of a woven Celtic pattern, seemingly embracing a starry night in her hands, from which pours the waters of life. On the back cover, you will see a very different depiction. This is the Goddess of womanly wrath, beautiful even as she is frightening; the very image of a woman who will protect her children by any means, and strike with a wrathful hand. 

Tree of Life Leather Blank Book (Yellow & Green)
Bedecked in wonderful Celtic imagery, this 4 1/2" by 6 1/2" leather-bound journal portrays the tree of life, with its far reaching branches snarled in a twisting canopy of Celtic knots and leafy foliage. Beneath this, the tree contorts into an ancient warped trunk and deep roots that spread out into a wide design of Celtic Knotswork weaving in and out of itself to create a wondrous, tangled pattern. 

Blue Celtic Leather Blank Book
Featuring hand-tooled leatherworking that you can lose yourself in for hours, the Blue Celtic leather blank book is intricately worked with complex patterns of knots, Triquetras, and spirals deeply rooted within Celtic traditions. Follow the patterns and grow mesmerized in the intricacies that can leave you drifting into a meditative trance all too readily. The leather, dyed a rich blue coloring, features a corded binding with the pages within, and a leather thong that can be coiled around the book to hold its cover securely shut.

* The Book of Shadows is a scared, private place where spells, rituals, and often inspirations are written. A Book of Shadows has the energy of the person who creates it, the spells within it and the spirit in which you keep it. Many Books of Shadow are handed down from generation to generation as blessings of those who honored the magick in times pasted.

Pentacle / Pentagram; The Pentagram / Pentacle is a symbol of a star encased in a circle. Always with 5 points (one pointing upward), each has its own meaning. The upward point of the star is representative of the spirit. The other four points all represent an element; earth, air, fire, and water. All these things contribute to who we are in life and are a part of the spirit of all things.

The pentagram has long been believed to be a potent protection against evil, a symbol of conflict that shields the wearer and the home. The pentagram five points outwards is believe to be a sign of personal defense, along with protective pentagon within the stars center.

Green 7 Knob Ritual Candles are primarily used for attracting money, wealth, and prosperity. Not yet Anointed.

name: Refill Set for Witches Apothecary Box and 12 Magick Herb Bottles  (EB)
description:
Refill Set for Witches Apothecary Box and 12 Magick Herb Bottles 

Each pouch is filled with the same herbs for your Herb Bottles in each set. Just open and refill your bottles so you are always ready and never run out.
 
Catnip: Used in cat magick and in creating a bond between human and cat. Is also used in love spells and, when grown near the home, can attract positive spirits and luck.

Mint: Used in healing spells and provokes lust. It also is used in money attraction spells and to remove negativity.
 
Sage: Used to promote long life or immortality, as well as, carried for wisdom and against evil. Used in healing and money spells. It is said that growing sage in your own garden brings bad luck.

Patchouli: Used in money and prosperity spells and is used in fertility magick. It attracts people and promotes lust. I also find it a nice incense for meditation.

Chamomile: Used for sleep and meditation, especially in tea form. Is also used for money and love attraction, as well as, to break curses or spells against you.

Wolfsbane: Used in Honoring Hekate, Protection, Invisibility. Brings protection and magickal watchfulness against negative energies in ritual. Brings protection negative energy.

Mugwort: Used to produce prophetic dreams and strengthen psychic powers, as well as, being used in divinations. It is carried to increase lust and fertility. It is also used to aid in astral projection.

Lavender: Used in love attraction spells and can protect against cruelty at the hands of a mate. When burned, it brings sleep and can be used in healing spells. It is said that just looking at a lavender plant can make you feel better. Use it in sachets and spellwork, as well as, in tea.

Mullein: Used to prevent nightmares bring courage and drive away negative energy. Mullein is used in magick as a substitute for Graveyard Dirt. Burned to bring psychic vision and summoning spirits. 

Sea Salt: Used for cleansing the circle, consecration and purification. Used to wash and cleanse magickal tools such a mirrors and athames. Also used in protective magick and ritual, as well as, for the cleansing and purification of crystals. 

Frankincense: Removes negative energy when burned. It is used in exorcisms and is carried to promote luck and protection.

Elderberries: Crone or Elder Work, Protection Spells and Divination.
Elderberries are used for protect, to induce vivid dreams, particularly of the Faerie realms. Used in healing spells and to exorcise or remove negative spells and influences are among Elder's pagan attributes.

Refills are designed for: Witch's Wood Apothecary Box Herb Set & 
Witches Herb Bottle Set: 12 Bottles of Witches Herbs for Spells & Magick.

We Witches love our Cauldrons! Most of us can not have enough of them and collect them in all sizes and shapes. I think it is because they put us in touch with our mystical past of standing at the fire stirring all manner of magick brews and healing potions. 

A cauldron is more than just a pot to cook in or to burn your incense.  It is also a symbol of the Goddess, a representation of abundance, knowledge and wisdom of the old ways and the old magick. Cauldrons are used in magick for calling spirits, knowledge, physical restoration, regeneration of life, transformation, and scrying or seeking the truth. Cauldrons are magickal vessels used to represent the Goddess, grounding to earth, the fire element and ritual magick.

This magickal brass Cauldron is a wonderful tool for your altar and all of your sacred rituals. Created out of solid brass in the classical cauldron design, with three short legs and two handles on either side, which in turn support a carrying handle that stretches between them. name: Keys of Magick and Light (5 Key Set)(FC)
description:
Keys of Magick and Light (5 Key Set)

I have found that many Witchâs and Pagans love Keys. Old keys, Skelton keys, latch keys all seem to have a magickal energy that draws us to them. Keys are often used in magick and spell work to lock and unlock a spell or to open the doorways into the veils as will as to honor the Goddess Hekate. Many Witches work with and honor the Goddess Hekate; Keys being one of her most powerful symbols.

This magickal set of 5 cast iron Keys are held within a metal ring. The Keys of Magick and Light Set when hung is just over 7 inches long. The center key which is the longest is 4 inches long. These Keys of Magick and Light are superbly painted in black and bronze patina to give them a mystical appearance. Hang then in your home to give a powerful statement of control and magick to any room or area they are placed.  

A Skeleton Key are seen as an amulet to open the doors of opportunity and success, and lock out or repel negative energies. In magick they are used for unlocking spells, magick, even the dreams of what is hidden within. Keys are a symbol of Hekate/Hecate the Goddess of Witches and Witchcraft since she carried and held the Keys to Hades. Therefore they have to power to shield and lock out those spirits that might cause harm or come into a home unwelcome.

description:
Wood Interwoven 3 Leg Crystal Ball Stand 6"

Carved of one piece of wood so as to not present any seams, this piece is perfect for holding your favorite divination tools or even just serving to honor your crystal ball in a mystical way. Carved into tangles of interwoven wood each leg sits loose, folding up into itself. 

This Interwoven Stand works wonderfully for holding your crystal ball but also holds your scrying bowls, cauldrons, candle dishes, crystal skulls, Witch balls, anything you would like honored or held within.

Once opened, it measures approximately 6" in diameter and 3 3/4" tall and are capable of holding anything from an 80 mm to a 180 mm crystal ball.
